workflow.name: WooCommerce order updates to customers via WhatsApp with Rapiwa API
workflow.description:
## Who is this for?
This workflow is for online store owners, support teams, and marketing staff who want to automatically verify WhatsApp numbers and send order invoice links or personalized order updates to customers. It‚Äôs built against WooCommerce order webhooks but can be adapted to Shopify or other e-commerce platforms that provide `billing` and `line_items`.

## What this Workflow Does
- Receives order events (Webhook / WooCommerce `order.updated`).
- Normalizes the payload into a compact object: `{ data: { customer, products, invoice_link } }` via a Code node.
- Iterates items in batches (`SplitInBatches`) to control throughput.
- Cleans phone numbers (removes non-digits) and verifies WhatsApp registration using Rapiwa (`/api/verify-whatsapp`).
- Sends templated WhatsApp messages through Rapiwa (`/api/send-message`) for verified numbers.
- Logs every attempt into Google Sheets: one sheet for verified & sent rows, another for unverified & not sent rows.
- Uses a `Wait` node to throttle and loop back into the batch processor.

## Key Features
- Trigger-based automation (Webhook or WooCommerce trigger).
- Payload normalization and mapping via JavaScript Code nodes.
- Controlled batching (SplitInBatches) to avoid rate limits.
- Pre-send verification of WhatsApp numbers using Rapiwa.
- Conditional branching with the IF node to separate verified vs unverified flows.
- Personalized message templates that pull customer and product fields from the mapped data.
- Logging and audit trail stored in Google Sheets (two separate append flows).

## How to Use ‚Äî Step-by-step Setup
1. Add credentials in n8n
   - Rapiwa: Create an HTTP Bearer credential and paste your Bearer token (example name used in the flow: `Rapiwa Bearer Auth`).
   - Google Sheets: Create an OAuth2 credential (example: `Google Sheets`).
   - WooCommerce: Add WooCommerce API credentials for the trigger (or configure Shopify credentials if adapting).

3. Import / configure nodes in n8n
   - Webhook (or WooCommerce Trigger): receive order payloads. Example Webhook path is present in the exported flow.
   - Code node `Format Webhook Response Data`: map `body.billing`, `body.line_items`, `body.payment_url` into `{ data: { customer, products, invoice_link } }`.
   - Code node `Clean WhatsApp Number`: ensure the phone number is a string and strip non-digits: `String(rawNumber).replace(/\D/g, "")`.
   - HTTP Request `Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa`: POST to `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp` with `{ number }`. Use the Rapiwa Bearer credential.
   - IF `If`: check verification result. The flow compares `{{$json.data.exists}}` to `"true"` in the exported flow; normalize types if your API returns booleans.
   - HTTP Request `Rapiwa Sender`: POST to `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` with `number`, `message_type: 'text'`, and a templated `message` (see message template in the flow).
   - Google Sheets `Store State of Rows in Verified & Sent` and `Store State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent`

## Google Sheet Column Structure
Create these columns exactly (the Google Sheets nodes in the flow expect these names):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WKOFqFdF3tqfes5KKO1WGAp20SpO3jJl9GsE9CmtfLI/edit?usp=sharing)

| Name            | Number        | Email             | Address      | Product Title                                  | Product ID | Size | Quantity | Total Price   | Product Image                                                                 | Invoice Link                                                                                             | Product Status | Validity   | Status   |
|-----------------|---------------|-------------------|--------------|------------------------------------------------|------------|------|----------|----------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|------------|----------|
| Abdul Mannan  | 8801322827799 | contact@spagreen.net   | mirpur dohs  | Air Force 1 Reigning Champ Dark Grey 1:1 - 40 | 251        | 40   | 1        | BDT 5800.00    | ![Product Image](https://rahxx23-WA0032.jpg)        | [Invoice](https://your_domainxxxr=truexxMqagSLWyft5t) | on-hold        | verified   | sent     |
| Abdul Mannan  | 8801322827799 | contact@spagreen.net   | mirpur dohs  | Air Force 1 Reigning Champ Dark Grey 1:1 - 40 | 251        | 40   | 1        | BDT 5800.00    | ![Product Image](https://rahixxxx20250323-WA0032.jpg)        | [Invoice](https://your_domainxxxrxxxer_wMqagSLWyft5t) | on-hold        | unverified | not sent |


## Customization Ideas
- Adapt the Code mapping node for Shopify payloads or other marketplaces.
- Iterate and include multiple products in the message instead of using `products[0]`.
- Add filters in the Code node (e.g., only process orders with `total > 5000`).
- Add fallback channels (SMS or email) for unverified numbers.
- Persist logs into a database for analytics and retention beyond Google Sheets.
- Add admin notifications (Slack, email) at the end of each run.

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

documentId.cachedResultName: WooCommerce - Send WhatsApp update to customer

parameters.content:
# WooCommerce Order Updates to Customers via WhatsApp with Rapiwa API
## Overview
The workflow listens for incoming WooCommerce order events‚Äîeither through a webhook or the `order.updated` trigger‚Äîand processes them to send WhatsApp status updates to customers via the Rapiwa API. Upon receiving an order payload, it formats and normalizes the data into a structured object containing customer details, product information, and an invoice link. Orders are handled in batches to manage throughput and avoid triggering rate limits. Phone numbers are cleaned and verified for WhatsApp registration using Rapiwa's verification endpoint. Messages are then sent to verified numbers using predefined templates, while all actions (both successful and failed attempts) are logged to Google Sheets for tracking.

## Features:
- Trigger-based processing (Webhook / WooCommerce trigger).
- Payload normalization via a Code node (`Format Webhook Response Data` / `Clean Webhooks Response Data`).
- Batch iteration using `SplitInBatches` (`Loop Over Items`).
- Phone cleaning (removes non-digit characters) in Code nodes.
- WhatsApp verification via Rapiwa (`/api/verify-whatsapp`).
- Conditional branching (IF node) to separate verified and unverified flows.
- Sending personalized messages via Rapiwa (`/api/send-message`) using template fields.
- Logging to Google Sheets for both verified (sent) and unverified (not sent) records.
- Wait node for throttling and re-entering the processing loop.

## Requirements:
- n8n instance with nodes: Webhook, HTTP Request, Code, SplitInBatches, IF, Google Sheets, Wait.
- Rapiwa account with a valid Bearer token for `verify-whatsapp` and `send-message` endpoints.
- Google account with Google Sheets and OAuth2 credentials configured in n8n.
- WooCommerce store with API/webhook access (or another source providing `billing` and `line_items` in the payload).

## Google Sheet Column Structure
Create these columns exactly (the Google Sheets nodes in the flow expect these names):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WKOFqFdF3tqfes5KKO1WGAp20SpO3jJl9GsE9CmtfLI/edit?usp=sharing)


## How to Use This Workflow:
1. Add credentials in n8n:
   - Rapiwa Bearer token ‚Üí HTTP Bearer credential.
   - Google Sheets OAuth2 ‚Üí Google Sheets credential.
   - WooCommerce API creds ‚Üí WooCommerce credential (or configure Shopify).
2. Prepare a Google Sheet with the required columns (see above).
3. Configure the Webhook node (or WooCommerce trigger) to receive order events.
4. Verify Code nodes correctly reference `billing`, `line_items`, and `payment_url` from your payload.
5. Set the SplitInBatches batch size and Wait delay to match your Rapiwa rate limits.
6. Run manual tests with 2‚Äì5 orders, verify Google Sheet entries and message delivery.


## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

## 1. Webhook
- Purpose: Accepts incoming HTTP POST requests (example path: `4746f380-002d-xxxx-90fe-7c963bd7a67b`).
- Usage: configured for test/webhook mode in sample `pinData`.

## 2. Format Webhook Response Data
- Purpose: Transform the raw `body` into a compact `data` object.
- Key behavior (JS):
  - Reads `body = item.json.body`.
  - Builds `customer` from `body.billing` (first_name, last_name, email, phone, address fields).
  - Maps `products` from `body.line_items` adding `status`, `name`, `size`, `product_id`, `variation_id`, `quantity`, `price`, `total`, `image`.
  - Returns `json: { data: { customer, products, invoice_link: body.payment_url } }`.

## 1. Clean WhatsApp Number
- Purpose: Ensure `number` field exists and strip non-digit characters.


## 2. Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa
- Purpose: Verify WhatsApp registration via Rapiwa API.

## 1. If
- False path: route to `Store State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent`.


## 2. Rapiwa Sender
- Purpose: Send personalized WhatsApp messages for verified numbers.
- Authentication: Rapiwa Bearer (`Rapiwa Bearer Auth`)


## 3. Store State of Rows in Verified & Sent
- Document: references a Google spreadsheet ID (example ID in the node configuration).
- Credential: `googleSheetsOAuth2Api` (Google Sheets credential).


## 4. Store State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent
- Purpose: Write a row for numbers that are not registered on WhatsApp.
- Credential: `googleSheetsOAuth2Api`.

main.node: Store State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent
Store State of Rows in Verified & Sent

user.name: Rapiwa
user.bio:
Simple, Reliable, Cost-Effective WhatsApp API
Rapiwa is a fast, reliable WhatsApp Business API Solution built for developers. Manage multiple sessions, scale your messaging, and enjoy transparent pricing with no per-message fees.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
